groups.title: 10.3.1 Information not within the Scope of Confidential Information
Information not within the Scope of Confidential Information Controls

controls.title: Information not within the Scope of Confidential Information

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: CAs operating under this policy must make this determination.

groups.title: Responsibility to Protect Confidential Information Controls

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A CA must not disclose non-certificate information to any third party unless authorized by this policy, required by U.S. law, U.S. government rule or regulation, or order of a U.S. court of competent jurisdiction.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The contents of the archives maintained by CAs operating under this policy must not be released except as required by this policy, required by U.S. law, U.S. government rule or regulation, or order of a U.S. court of competent jurisdiction.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: CAs must conduct a Privacy Threshold Assessment, and implement and maintain any required Privacy Impact Assessments and Privacy Plans in accordance with the requirements of the Privacy Act of 1974, as amended.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Federal entities acquiring services under this policy must protect all Subscriber PII from unauthorized disclosure.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Records of individual transactions may be released upon request of any Subscribers involved in the transaction or their legally recognized agents.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The contents of the archives maintained by CAs operating under this policy must not be released except as required by law.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Collection of PII must be limited to the minimum necessary to validate the identity of the Subscriber.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: This may include attributes that correlate identity evidence to authoritative sources.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The RA must provide explicit notice to the Subscriber regarding the purpose for collecting and maintaining a record of the PII necessary for identity proofing and the consequences for not providing the information.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: PII collected for identity proofing purposes must not be used for any other purpose.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information included in certificates is not subject to protections outlined in Section 9.4.2, but may not be sold to a third party.

groups.title: Responsibility to Protect Private Information Controls

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Sensitive information must be stored securely, and may be released only in accordance with other stipulations in Section 9.4.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: All information collected as part of the identity proofing process must be protected to ensure confidentiality and integrity.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: In the event an agency terminates PKI activities, it must be responsible for disposing of or destroying sensitive information, including PII, in a secure manner, and maintaining its protection from unauthorized access until destruction.

groups.title: 10.4.4 Notice and Consent to Use Private Information
Notice and Consent to Use Private Information Controls

controls.title: Notice and Consent to Use Private Information

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The FPKIMA or an agency POC is not required to provide any notice or obtain the consent of the Subscriber or authorized agency personnel in order to release private information in accordance with other stipulations of Section 9.4.

groups.title: 10.4.5 Disclosure Pursuant to Judicial or Administrative Process
Disclosure Pursuant to Judicial or Administrative Process Controls

controls.title: Disclosure Pursuant to Judicial or Administrative Process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The FPKIMA or an agency POC must not disclose private information to any third party unless authorized by this policy, required by law, government rule or regulation, or order of a court of competent jurisdiction.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any request for release of information must be processed according to \[41 CFR 105-60.605\].

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: None.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: CAs must not knowingly violate intellectual property rights held by others.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The obligations described below pertain to the FPKIMA and each issuing agency.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The FPKIPA must:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Approve the CPS for each CA that issues certificates under this policy;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Review periodic compliance audits to ensure that CAs are operating in compliance with their approved CPSs;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Review namespace control procedures to ensure that distinguished names are uniquely assigned for all certificates issued under this CP;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Revise this CP to maintain the level of assurance and operational practicality;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Publicly distribute this CP; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Coordinate modifications to this CP to ensure continued compliance by CAs operating under approved CPSs.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Each issuing agency must:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Review periodic compliance audits to ensure that RAs and other components operated by the agency are operating in compliance with their approved CPSs; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Review namespace control procedures to ensure that distinguished names are uniquely assigned within their agency.

groups.title: 10.6.0 CA and KED Representations and Warranties
CA and KED Representations and Warranties Controls

controls.title: CA and KED Representations and Warranties

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: CAs operating under this policy must warrant that their procedures are implemented in accordance with this CP, and that any certificates issued that assert the policy OIDs identified in this CP were issued in accordance with the stipulations of this policy.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A CA that issues certificates that assert a policy defined in this document must conform to the stipulations of this document, including:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Providing to the FPKIPA a CPS, as well as any subsequent changes, for conformance assessment.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Maintaining its operations in conformance to the stipulations of the approved CPS.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Ensuring that registration information is accepted only from approved RAs operating under an approved CPS.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Including only valid and appropriate information in certificates, and maintaining evidence that due diligence was exercised in validating the information contained in the certificates.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Revoking the certificates of Subscribers found to have acted in a manner counter to their obligations in accordance with Section 9.6.3.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Operating or providing for the services of an on-line repository, and informing the repository service provider of their obligations if applicable.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A KED that provides escrowed keys to Requestors under this policy must conform to the stipulations of this document.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: In particular, the following stipulations apply:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The FPKIPA must approve the CPS/KRPS prior to key escrow.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KED must operate in accordance with the stipulations of the CPS/KRPS and this policy.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The CA/KED must automatically notify the subscribers when their private keys have been escrowed during the subscriber registration process (e.g., a dialog box may appear on a subscriber’s screen during the certificate request process).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KED must monitor KRA and KRO activity for patterns of potentially anomalous activity as indicators of possible problems in the infrastructure, and initiate inquiries or investigations as appropriate

groups.title: 10.6.1 RA and KRA/KRO Representations and Warranties

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: An RA that performs registration functions as described in this policy must comply with the stipulations of this policy, and comply with a CPS approved by the FPKIPA for use with this policy.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: An RA who is found to have acted in a manner inconsistent with these obligations is subject to revocation of RA responsibilities.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: An RA supporting this policy must conform to the stipulations of this document, including:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Maintaining its operations in conformance to the stipulations of the approved CPS.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Including only valid and appropriate information in certificate requests, and maintaining evidence that due diligence was exercised in validating the information contained in the certificate.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Ensuring that obligations are imposed on Subscribers in accordance with Section 9.6.3, and that Subscribers are informed of the consequences of not complying with those obligations.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: KRAs that submit requests as described in this policy must comply with the stipulations of this policy and the applicable CPS/KRPS.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: In particular, the following stipulations apply:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must keep a copy of this policy and the applicable CPS/KRPS.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must protect subscribers’ escrowed keys from unauthorized disclosure, including the encrypted files and associated decryption keys.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must protect all information associated with key recovery, including the KRA’s own key(s), that could be used to recover subscribers’ escrowed keys.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must release Subscribers’ escrowed keys only for properly authenticated and authorized requests from Requestor.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs may rely upon the KROs for authentication and verification of the identity and authority of the Requestor.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: However, KRAs must also authenticate the identity of the Requestor when the Requestor digital signature is available.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must authenticate the KROs as described in Section 3.5.4.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must validate the authorization of the KRO by ensuring that the KRO is an authorized KRO for the Subscriber for whom key recovery has been requested.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must protect all information regarding all occurrences of key recovery.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must communicate knowledge of a recovery process only to the KRO and Requestor involved in the key recovery.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must not communicate any information concerning a key recovery to the Subscriber except when the Subscriber is the Requestor.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - KRAs must monitor KRO activity for patterns of potentially anomalous behavior as indicators of possible problems in the infrastructure, and initiate inquiries or investigations as appropriate.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A KRO initiates a key recovery request for a Requestor.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: When using the services of a KRO, the Requestor is generally a third party, but this policy does not preclude the Subscriber from seeking the assistance of a KRO to recover the Subscriber’s private key.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO must protect Subscribers’ recovered keys from compromise.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - After providing the Requestor with the encrypted key, the KRO must destroy the copy of the key in his/her system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO must request the Subscriber’s keys only upon receipt of a request from an authorized Requestor.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO, as an intermediary for the KRA, must validate the identity of any Requestor seeking a key recovery.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - When the Requestor is authenticated on the basis of digital signature, the KRO must forward the Requestor’s digitally signed object to the KRA in a form verifiable by the KRA.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - In the case of persons other than the Subscriber seeking a key recovery, the KRO must ensure that the Requestor has the authority to request the Subscriber’s private decryption key.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO, as an intermediary for the KRA, must validate the authorization for the request, to include consultation with legal counsel when appropriate.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO must protect all information associated with key recovery, including the KRO’s own private key(s), that could be used to obtain the Subscriber's recovered private decryption key(s).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO must protect all information regarding all occurrences of key recovery.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO must communicate knowledge of any recovery process only to the Requestor

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO must not communicate any information concerning a key recovery to the Subscriber except when the Subscriber is the Requestor.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO must accurately represent himself when requesting key recovery services.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The KRO must keep records of all recovery requests and disposition, including acknowledgement of receipt by the Requestor.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: If an Issuing Organization chooses not to implement the KRO role, then these obligations become the responsibility of the KRA in addition to the obligations in Section 9.6.2.2 above.

groups.title: 10.6.2 Subscriber and Data Decryption Server Representations and Warranties

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A Subscriber (or human sponsor for device certificates) must be required to sign a document containing the requirements the Subscriber must meet respecting protection of the private key and use of the certificate before being issued the certificate.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Wherever possible, Subscriber documents must be digitally signed.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Subscribers must:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Accurately represent themselves in all communications with the PKI authorities.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Protect their private key(s) at all times, in accordance with this policy, as stipulated in their certificate acceptance agreements and local procedures.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Promptly notify the appropriate CA upon suspicion of loss or compromise of their private key(s).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Such notification must be made directly or indirectly through mechanisms consistent with the CA’s CPS.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Abide by all the terms, conditions, and restrictions levied on the use of their private key(s) and certificate(s).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Subscribers must provide accurate identification and authentication information during key recovery requests.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - When the Subscriber is notified that his or her escrowed key has been recovered, the Subscriber must determine whether revocation of the public key certificate associated with the recovered key is necessary.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The Subscriber must request the revocation, if necessary.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: If the human sponsor for a device is not physically located near the sponsored device, and/or does not have sufficient administrative privileges on the sponsored device to protect the device’s private key and ensure that the device’s certificate is only used for authorized purposes, the device sponsor may delegate these responsibilities to an authorized administrator for the device.

groups.title: 10.6.3.1 Data Decryption Server Representations and Warranties
Data Decryption Server Representations and Warranties Controls

controls.title: Data Decryption Server Representations and Warranties

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Prior to the beginning of the operation of a DDS, the Issuing Organization must formally acknowledge and agree to the obligations described here by signing an appropriate document.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The DDS must protect Subscribers’ recovered key(s) from compromise.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The DDS must use a combination of computer security, cryptographic, network security, physical security, personnel security, and procedural security controls to protect their keys and recovered subscribers’ keys.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The DDS must destroy Subscribers’ keys when no longer required (i.e., when the data has been recovered).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The DDS must request the Subscriber’s escrowed key(s) only upon receiving a request to decrypt subscriber data from an authenticated authorized Enterprise system (e.g., an e-mail Server)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The DDS must use the Subscriber’s recovered keys only to recover Subscriber’s data requested from an authenticated authorized Enterprise system

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The DDS must provide accurate identification and authentication information at the same or higher assurance level as required for issuing new PKI certificates at the assurance level of the key being requested.

groups.title: Relying Parties Representations and Warranties Controls

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: This CP does not specify the steps a relying party should take to determine whether to rely upon a certificate.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The relying party decides, pursuant to its own policies, what steps to take.

groups.title: 10.6.4 Representations and Warranties of Other Participants
Representations and Warranties of Other Participants Controls

controls.title: Representations and Warranties of Other Participants

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Third-party key recovery Requestors must formally acknowledge and agree to the obligations described here, prior to receiving a recovered key:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Requestor must protect Subscribers’ recovered key(s) from compromise.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Requestor must use a combination of computer security, cryptographic, network security, physical security, personnel security, and procedural security controls to protect their keys and recovered Subscribers’ keys.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Third-Party Requestor must destroy Subscribers’ keys when no longer required (i.e., when the data has been recovered).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Requestor must request and use the Subscriber’s escrowed key(s) only to recover Subscriber’s data they are authorized to access.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Requestor must accurately represent themselves to all entities during any key recovery service.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - When the request is made, the Requestor must provide accurate identification and authentication information at least to the same level required for issuing new PKI certificates at the level of the key being requested (e.g., the Requestor sends a digitally signed request using the credential issued by the Entity PKI at the same or higher assurance level as the key being recovered).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The Third-Party Requestor must protect information concerning each key recovery operation.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - The Third-Party Requestor must communicate information concerning the recovery to the Subscriber when appropriate as determined by the reason for the recovery.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The decision to notify the Subscriber must be based on the law and the Issuing Organization’s policies and procedures for third party information access.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - In the event that the Third-Party Requestor notifies the Subscriber of a key recovery, the Requestor must consult with the Subscriber to determine whether or not the recovery circumstances warrant revoking the associated public key certificate.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - As a condition of receiving a recovered key, a Requestor must agree to follow the law and the Issuing Organization’s policies relating to protection and release of the recovered key.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: - Upon receipt of the recovered key(s), the Third-Party Requestor must sign an attestation to the effect:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: > “I hereby state that I have legitimate and official need to recover this key in order to obtain (recover) the encrypted data that I have authorization to access.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: I acknowledge receipt of a recovered encryption key associated with the Subscriber identified here \[Subscriber Name\].

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: I certify that I have accurately identified myself to the KRO, and truthfully described all reasons that I require access to data protected by the recovered key.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: I acknowledge my responsibility to use this recovered key only for the stated purposes, to protect it from further exposure, and to destroy all key materials or return them to the KRO when no longer needed.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: I understand that I am bound by \[Issuing Organization\] policies, applicable laws and Federal regulations concerning the protection of the recovered key and any data recovered using the key.”

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: CAs operating under this policy may not disclaim any responsibilities described in this CP.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The U.S. Government must not be liable to any party, except as determined pursuant to the \[Federal Tort Claims Act (FTCA), 28 U.S.C. 2671-2680\], or as determined through a valid express written contract between the Government and another party.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: No stipulation.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: This CP becomes effective when approved by the FPKIPA.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: This CP has no specified term.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Termination of this CP is at the discretion of the FPKIPA.

groups.title: Effect of Termination and Survival Controls

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The requirements of this CP remain in effect through the end of the archive period for the last certificate issued.

groups.title: 10.10 Individual Notices and Communications with Participants
Individual Notices and Communications with Participants Controls

controls.title: Individual Notices and Communications with Participants

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The FPKIPA must establish appropriate procedures for communications with CAs operating under this policy via contracts or memoranda of agreement as applicable.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: For CAs operating under this policy, any planned changes to the infrastructure that have the potential to affect the FPKI operational environment must be communicated to the FPKIPA at least two weeks prior to implementation.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: All new artifacts (CA certificates, CRL DP, AIA and/or SIA URLs, etc.) produced as a result of the change must be provided to the FPKIPA within 24 hours following implementation.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: For all other communications, no stipulation.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The FPKIPA must review this CP at least once every year.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Corrections, updates, or changes to this CP must be publicly available.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Suggested changes to this CP must be communicated to the contact in Section 1.5.2; such communication must include a description of the change, a change justification, and contact information for the person requesting the change.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Proposed changes to this CP must be distributed electronically to FPKIPA members and observers in accordance with the Charter and By-laws.

groups.title: 10.12.2 Circumstances under which OID must be Changed
Circumstances under which OID must be Changed Controls

controls.title: Circumstances under which OID must be Changed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: OIDs will be changed if the FPKIPA determines that a change in the CP reduces the level of assurance provided.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The FPKIPA must facilitate the resolution between entities when conflicts arise as a result of the use of certificates issued under this policy.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: When the dispute is between federal agencies, and the FPKIPA is unable to facilitate resolution, dispute resolution may be escalated to the White House Office of Management and Budget or to the U.S. Department of Justice, Office of Legal Counsel as necessary.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The construction, validity, performance and effect of certificates issued under this CP for all purposes must be governed by United States federal law (statute, case law, or regulation).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: All CAs operating under this policy are required to comply with applicable law.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: CAs operating under this policy must make this determination.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: CAs operating under this policy must make this determination.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Should it be determined that one section of this CP is incorrect or invalid, the other sections of this CP must remain in effect until the CP is updated.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The process for updating this CP is described in Section 9.12.
